meanings.definition: A heavily built omnivorous nocturnal mammal of the weasel family, typically having a gray and black coat.
meanings.sent1: The badger dug a deep burrow to make its home.
meanings.sent2: I saw a badger scurrying across the field at night.
meanings.sent3: The badger decided to take a nap in the cozy burrow.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to finish the project was as strong as a badger's will to dig.
meanings.sent5: The badger's fur was a mix of gray and black, blending perfectly with the night.

meanings.sent1: Stop trying to badger me into sharing my snacks.
meanings.sent2: She would always badger him with questions about his day.
meanings.sent3: The children would badger their parents for ice cream after dinner.
meanings.sent4: The persistent salesman would badger customers to buy unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The reporter continued to badger the celebrity for an interview, despite multiple refusals.

meanings.definition: A native or resident of Wisconsin.
meanings.sent1: The badger proudly displayed the Wisconsin flag on his backpack.
meanings.sent2: She met a friendly badger from Wisconsin at the conference.
meanings.sent3: The badger from Wisconsin brought cheese curds to the potluck.
meanings.sent4: The badger's love for Wisconsin was evident in every conversation.
meanings.sent5: The Wisconsin badger cheered for the local football team at the game.
